titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ مَنْ دَعَا اسْتُجِيبَ لَهُ
titles.en: Chapter 5 – The one who supplicates, it would be Answered for him

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ مَنْ دَعَا اسْتُجِيبَ لَهُ
titles.en: Chapter 5 – The one who supplicates, it would be Answered for him

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مَيْمُونٍ الْقَدَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ الدُّعَاءُ كَهْفُ الْإِجَابَةِ كَمَا أَنَّ السَّحَابَ كَهْفُ الْمَطَرِ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin isa, from Al Hassan Bin Ali, from Abdullah Bin Maymoun Al Qaddah,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The supplication and pleading before Allah for help is the means of its acceptance just as clouds are means of rain’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْأَشْعَرِيِّ عَنِ ابْنِ الْقَدَّاحِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَا أَبْرَزَ عَبْدٌ يَدَهُ إِلَى اللَّهِ الْعَزِيزِ الْجَبَّارِ إِلَّا اسْتَحْيَا اللَّهُ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ أَنْ يَرُدَّهَا صِفْراً حَتَّى يَجْعَلَ فِيهَا مِنْ فَضْلِ رَحْمَتِهِ مَا يَشَاءُ فَإِذَا دَعَا أَحَدُكُمْ فَلَا يَرُدَّ يَدَهُ حَتَّى يَمْسَحَ عَلَى وَجْهِهِ وَ رَأْسِهِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Ja’far Bin Muhammad Al Ashary, from Ibn Al Qaddah,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘A servant would not bring out his hands to Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, the Strong, the Compeller, except that Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic would be too Embarrassed that He<sup>azwj</sup> returns his hand empty until He<sup>azwj</sup> Makes it to be in it from the Grace of His<sup>azwj</sup> Mercy, whatever He<sup>azwj</sup> so Desires to. So whenever one of you supplicates, so he should not return his hand until he has wiped it upon his face and his head’.
